translation.en: [man on radio] And now the news from Europe.
With British forces withdrawn from the continent,
the Nazis presently command the English Channel, the Atlantic coast, and the north of France,
translation.ko: 나치가 영국 해협, 대서양 해안 프랑스 북부를 점령하면서

translation.en: forcing multitudes to flee Paris for the unoccupied zone in the south.
translation.ko: 많은 이들이 파리를 떠나 남부 자유 지역으로 향했습니다

translation.en: [man] The last free port of Marseille teems with refugees from all over Europe,
translation.ko: 마지막 남은 마르세유항에는 유럽 전역의 난민들이 모여들어

translation.en: desperately seeking travel visas and funds to depart for the new world.
translation.ko: 미대륙으로 가기 위해 필요한 비자와 자금을 마련 중입니다

translation.en: This came for you today in my diplomatic pouch.
Go ahead. It won't bite.
My father is demanding that I come home to Chicago.
He's bought me a ticket for tomorrow night.
He has been asking nicely ever since the Nazis marched into Paris.
translation.ko: 석 달 전, 파리가 점령당한 후로 줄곧 좋은 말로 당부해 오셨죠

translation.en: He's done being nice. He's threatening to cut me off.
translation.ko: 이젠 좋은 말이 아니라 연을 끊겠다고 협박하시네요

translation.en: Can you blame him? His only daughter gallivanting around wartime Marseille
translation.ko: 그게 잘못됐나요? 하나뿐인 딸이 히틀러의 수배자들과 어울리며

translation.en: with Hitler's most wanted?
I'm trying to save their lives.
Come on, Ms. Gold. Be good. Go home. Settle down with a nice guy.
translation.ko: 골드 양, 말 들으세요 귀국해서 남들처럼 좋은 남자 만나 정착해요

translation.en: -Well, I don't see you rushing home. -I'm here for work.
translation.ko: 그러는 당신은 왜 안 가죠? 난 일하러 왔잖아요

translation.en: And so am I.
These are some of Europe's finest minds, Mr. Patterson,
and America would be lucky to have them.
-You know what makes America great? -Please remind me.
translation.ko: - 미국이 왜 위대한 줄 아세요? - 너무 듣고 싶네요

translation.en: The hammer. There's 50 different kinds of hammer in the United States.
translation.ko: 망치, 미국이 만든 망치 종류만 50가지가 넘어요

translation.en: -Fifty. -What was wrong with the first one?
Nothing. And they're already working on the 51st.
That's American ingenuity for you.
These European intellectuals are just staring at their own navels.
Says you.
[Patterson] Do you really wanna help that badly? Send money from Chicago.
translation.ko: 그렇게까지 돕고 싶어요? 시카고에 가서 돈을 보내요

translation.en: Will you please speak to my father for me?
He thinks you're a man with common sense.
Maybe.
If you'll excuse me, I have to powder my nose.
Here. Take it. The boy didn't even touch it.
Are you trying to get out of Marseille?
Isn't everybody?
We both got away from Paris.
I can get you on the boat to New York tomorrow. The MS Rex.
You can get visas?
No, but if you go at 6:00 a.m.,
they will be loading cargo in the back of the ship.
translation.ko: 배 뒤쪽에 화물을 싣고 있을 텐데

translation.en: You talk to Lionel, and he can get you on.
As stowaways?
Yes.
I'm traveling with my brother.
Then I… I'll pay Lionel for both of you.
Why?
I have the money. I can do it. Does it matter why?
Here. If you need to reach me, you can find me here.
I'm working with the Emergency Rescue Committee
translation.ko: 스플렌디드 호텔에 있는 긴급 구조 위원회에서

translation.en: at the Hotel Splendide.
If you clean yourself up, you can go up on the deck once the ship sets sail,
translation.ko: 말끔하게만 입으면 출항 후에 갑판에 올라가도

translation.en: and no one will notice.
-Did you-- -Oh, I just fixed my hair.
Do you like it?
-[in French] Good morning. -Good morning.
-[In French] Good morning, Paul. -Mary Jayne.
[in French] Special delivery for Mademoiselle Gold!
[in English] Can you get this to Lionel? I have two more for the boat.
translation.ko: 내일 아침까지 리오넬한테 전해줄래요? 탑승자가 두 명 더 있어요

translation.en: [Paul] No problem.
Dagobert.
-[in French] Hello. -Hello.
-[man in English] Here's your lunch. -I thank you.
[man] Thank you.
-Varian Fry. -[knocking]
-[in French] This way. -[Varian] Thanks.
[in English] How goes your Rescue Committee?
Emergency Rescue Committee.
translation.ko: - 미국 긴급 구조 위원회입니다 - 번쩍이는 말을 탄 기사들

translation.en: Knights on shining horses. Or is it shining knights on…
translation.ko: - 미국 긴급 구조 위원회입니다 - 번쩍이는 말을 탄 기사들 번쩍이는 갑옷인가? 매번 까먹어요

translation.en: I always forget.
I saw your Miss Gold today.
Miss Gold. She's indispensable to our operation.
A spoiled young lady with no clue about the real world.
translation.ko: 오냐오냐 자라서 세상 물정 모르는 아가씨지만

translation.en: Her daddy's money is indispensable. Let's hope he keeps it coming, hm?
translation.ko: 그 아버지의 돈은 필수적이죠 계속 받아내자고요

translation.en: Mr. Patterson,
why are you stonewalling Mr. Benjamin's visa request?
translation.ko: 베냐민 씨의 비자 신청을 왜 미루시는 거죠?

translation.en: This is a matter of life and death.
It always is.
People here have been killing since the Trojan War.
translation.ko: 트로이 전쟁 때부터 유럽의 역사는 살인의 역사였어요

translation.en: The Trojan War was fought for love. The Nazis are driven only by hate--
translation.ko: 트로이 전쟁의 원인이 사랑이라면 나치는 오직 증오로 움직이는…

translation.en: You're a guest here, Mr. Fry.
The United States has a neutral position in this war. Don't forget that.
translation.ko: 미국은 이번 전쟁에서 중립을 택했다는 걸 명심하세요

translation.en: You and I are in wartime France at the pleasure of the French authorities.
translation.ko: 전시에도 여기 지낼 수 있는 건 프랑스 측의 배려 덕분이에요

translation.en: Most Americans wouldn't come here to begin with.
translation.ko: 물론 미국인이라면 애당초 여기 안 오겠죠

translation.en: My own wife refused to join me.
So,
what are you really doing here, Mr. Fry?
You bored at home?
Unhappy marriage?
Innocent people's lives are being ruined, Mr. Patterson.
translation.ko: 무고한 사람들의 삶이 망가지고 있습니다, 영사님

translation.en: They're being wrongfully incarcerated.
Even killed.
Last week, two more people on my list committed suicide.
translation.ko: 지난주에는 구조 대상 두 명이 목숨을 끊었어요

translation.en: These refugees need help, and no one else is lifting a finger.
translation.ko: 도움이 필요한 난민들을 위해 아무도 나서질 않고 있어요

translation.en: I don't need a better reason.
Well, as an American, I expect you to behave yourself in Marseille.
translation.ko: 같은 미국인으로서 처신 잘하기를 부탁하는 겁니다

translation.en: Do that for me, and I'll figure out Mr. Benjamin's visa.
translation.ko: 그렇게만 해주면 베냐민 씨 비자는 해결해 드리죠

translation.en: Thank you.
Please leave the food outside. Thank you.
[Mary Jayne] Mr. Benjamin, it's me. Mary Jayne.
Now please release me from this purgatory.
[Mary Jayne] The MS Rex is in the harbor, ready to take you to New York.
translation.ko: 뉴욕으로 모실 렉스호가 항구에서 기다리고 있어요

translation.en: [Benjamin] What are you doing?
No, Mr. Benjamin, it smells like a hash den in here.
translation.ko: 뭐긴요, 방에서 마약 소굴 냄새가 나잖아요

translation.en: If the French find me here, they'll send me to the prison camps,
translation.ko: 프랑스 당국에 발각되면 수용소로 돌아가야 하는데

translation.en: and I can't go back there.
[Mary Jayne] I understand.
I really do.
My Berlin was a paradise. Now they've destroyed it.
translation.ko: 낙원 같았던 나의 베를린을 놈들이 망쳐놨어요

translation.en: Please don't touch that.
It's the only thing that I have left from my past.
You know, you're lucky.
You can go back home.
Well, I don't know about that. [scoffs]
[man] Come.
Come.
[in German] Let's share my challah.
[in German] I thought you were Jews, like everyone here.
We are.
We were. We just never really…
Our parents left all that behind.
Your parents left all that behind,
and yet they are still Jewish enough for Hitler?
Yes. [chuckles]
[woman] Thank you.
[man] Thank you.
[in German] My daughter is waiting in New York.
She wanted me to leave Germany with her. That was two years ago.
translation.ko: 같이 독일을 떠나자고 했었는데 그게 2년 전이네요

translation.en: Why didn't you leave?
Stupidity.
Pride.
Do you have the documents to be able to leave?
[man 1] No, not yet.
But I have unwavering faith and trust in God.
translation.ko: 하지만 나에겐 야훼를 향한 흔들리지 않는 믿음이 있고

translation.en: And…
[man 1] Perseverance.
If Abraham can survive the ten tests,
translation.ko: 아브라함도 열 가지 시험을 통과할 수 있었으니

translation.en: then we can survive this too.
-[in English] Hello. -Speak of the devil.
translation.ko: - 안녕하세요 - 호랑이도 제 말 하면 온다더니

translation.en: Oh, gee, thanks.
[woman] Where's your dress?
Seriously, what are you wearing?
-[Varian] Down to the beach again? -No.
[Varian] Our job's difficult enough.
Just find the 200 people on the list approved by the State Department,
get them out on boats to the US.
While the American government is hoarding all of the visas
translation.ko: 미국 정부가 비자를 안 주는데 무슨 소용이죠?

translation.en: and we have how many people hiding out in this hotel?
translation.ko: 이 호텔에 몇 명이 숨어 지내는지 아세요?

translation.en: Poor Mr. Benjamin is on the verge of a nervous breakdown.
translation.ko: 베냐민 씨는 딱하게도 신경쇠약이 오기 직전이에요

translation.en: I'm working on him.
The Museum of Modern Art is working on Ernst and Breton.
translation.ko: 현대 미술관은 에른스트와 브르통의 비자를 재촉 중이고요

translation.en: You've been in Marseille for how long now, Varian?
translation.ko: 베리언이 마르세유에 온 지 얼마나 됐죠?

translation.en: What is it, two months?
And in all that time,
how many people from the committee's famous list
translation.ko: 그 잘난 명단 중에서 구조한 사람이

translation.en: have you officially managed to rescue?
-[Varian] Not enough. -Eleven people.
Eleven people! That's it.
Do you think I don't know that?
I haven't managed one tenth of what I've set out to do.
My wife's already demanding I come home.
I'm sorry. It's just the port is… It's overflowing with desperate people.
translation.ko: 미안해요, 하지만 항구에 도움이 필요한 사람이 너무 많아요

translation.en: You're not the only person who cares.
But this isn't a mob operation.
We have to concentrate our resources.
You mean my money.
[Varian] Yes, your money.
My time.
Lena's time.
Look, if we don't concentrate on who we've set out to rescue,
translation.ko: 구조 명단에 있는 사람들에게 집중하지 않으면

translation.en: we're never gonna get anything done.
[in German] You know how he looks?
Lionel?
Lionel!
[in English] A woman sent us.
Mary Jayne Gold.
She only paid for two.
[Lionel in French] Listen up!
Take the dinghy and hurry over to the stern side of the boat.
translation.ko: 이걸 타고 빠르게 가서 큰 배 뒤쪽으로 탑승하면

translation.en: Our men will tell you where to hide. Understood?
Okay.
[Lionel] Documented passengers board when the ship comes into port.
translation.ko: 서류가 준비된 승객들은 정박한 뒤에 탑승할 거고

translation.en: You'll board now, before the cargo.
translation.ko: 당신들은 짐 싣기 전에 탑승하는 거예요

translation.en: Stay in the hold till the anchor is raised. Okay?
translation.ko: 닻을 올릴 때까지는 선창에서 나오지 마요, 알았죠?

translation.en: [in German] Isn't he coming?
[in German] Shit.
[woman] Oh no!
No! No, no, no!
No, no, no, no!
[man in French] Police. [woman in English] Don't stop.
[man in German] Ursula, we need to jump! Take off your coat.
[man in German] You'll be too heavy.
-[Ursula] Can he swim? -Quick!
Ursula!
Ursula!
[Ursula] Albert!
[Albert] Can you see him?
-No, I can't find him! -I'll go back down. Stay here!
translation.ko: - 아니, 못 찾겠어! - 내가 갈게, 여기 있어!

translation.en: [Ursula] Albert!
[Ursula] Albert!
Did you try to swim to America?
Easier than getting an exit visa.
At least I survived.
An old man drowned trying.
Exit stamps, entry papers,
transit visas…
The Nazis took inspiration from Kafka.
Thank you.
An American tried to help us, but…
Americans?
Forget it.
We have to help ourselves.
[in English] Mr. Benjamin, I assure you that we are gonna get you out of here.
translation.ko: 베냐민 씨, 제가 책임지고 마르세유 밖으로 모시겠습니다

translation.en: There was no way to anticipate what happened…
translation.ko: 오늘 일은 아무도 예상 못 한…

translation.en: What's going on?
-[Varian] Police round-up on the MS Rex. -[Mary Jayne] What?
Caught dozens of refugees trying to stow away.
translation.ko: 화물칸에 숨으려던 난민 수십 명이 체포됐죠

translation.en: The boat's been impounded.
Can you take the dog, please?
-Sorry, I have to go. -Mary Jayne.
[in German] I'll die in this godforsaken country.
-[Mary Jayne in French] Is this enough? -No.
[man] Let's go, ladies.
-[in German] What's going on? -Just keep walking.
How can we help ourselves?
Tell me.
[in English] You set us up?
No. I swear to you, I didn't. I thought it would work. I bailed you out.
translation.ko: - 우릴 속였어요? - 아뇨 맹세코 그런 게 아니에요 내가 보석으로 꺼낸 거예요

translation.en: I'm so sorry.
Uh, your brother should be here too.
[in German] Did you see my brother?
[in English] Did you see my brother? He's… He's this tall, blue eyes.
translation.ko: 제 동생 봤어요? 키가 크고 눈은 파란색이에요

translation.en: Oh yeah. I think they took him aside as we were coming out.
translation.ko: 아, 나올 때 그 사람만 데려갔어요

translation.en: -[Ursula] He's still inside? -Yeah.
[in German] My brother's still inside. Please, you have to help us.
translation.ko: 제 동생이 안에 있어요 제발 도와주세요

translation.en: I've found an unguarded path over the mountains.
translation.ko: 경비가 지키지 않는 길을 산맥에서 찾았어요

translation.en: Over the Pyrenees? On foot? That's impossible.
I'm leaving now. Come if you want.
[in English] Please let me make it up to you.
translation.ko: 내 실수를 만회할 수 있게 해줘요

translation.en: -She found a pass into Spain. -[Mary Jayne] What?
translation.ko: 산맥을 넘어 스페인으로 가는 길을 찾았대요 - 뭐라고요? - 저 사람은 누구죠?

translation.en: [in German] Who's that?
[in English] You can trust me. Please. I wanna help.
translation.ko: 날 믿어줘요 정말 돕고 싶어서 그래요

translation.en: [in English] The path starts outside Banyuls-sur-Mer.
[in German] Albert, I…
-[in English] I can't leave Albert. -I'll wait for him.
translation.ko: - 알베르트를 두고는 못 가요 - 내가 여기서 기다릴게요

translation.en: -You'd do that? -Here… one second.
[in German] Can we really trust her?
[in English] Show me. I'll make sure he finds you.
translation.ko: 지도 다시 보여줘요 그곳으로 가라고 할게요

translation.en: We can't wait for him.
Border guards start patrolling at sunrise. They shoot to kill.
translation.ko: 동이 트면 국경 수비대가 나타나 총을 쏘기 시작할 거예요

translation.en: Then I will make sure that he is right behind you, I promise.
Okay, just outside Banyuls-sur-Mer, there is a stone house.
translation.ko: 좋아요, 바니울스쉬르메르 밖에 돌집이 한 채 있어요

translation.en: You want to turn right. Okay? And then you see the vineyards…
Hirschman. Sir.
[in French] An old German name.
-[in English] Difficult. -Hm.
[in French] Maybe. It's spelled differently in each of your passports.
So, which is the real one?
Or are they all fake?
[in English] Uh, you fought at Hannut?
[in French] You fought at Hannut?
Ah, yes.
I still don't understand how it all went south so quickly.
translation.ko: 어쩌다 전세가 역전된 건지 아직도 도무지 모르겠네만

translation.en: I served…
in the French immigrant infantry division,
translation.ko: 이민자 병사들로 구성된 보병 사단에 소속되어

translation.en: east of Paris.
[in English] It's where my French passport comes from.
General Georges gave it to me himself.
translation.ko: 조르주 장군님이 직접 하사해 주신 여권인데

translation.en: I used this one
to fight for the republicans in Spain.
This one here got me into Italy to study economics
translation.ko: 이탈리아에서 경제학을 공부할 때 사용한 여권도 있습니다

translation.en: until the fascists kicked me out.
And this one…
This one got me out of Germany in '33.
[in French] So which is your real identity?
[in English] If you ask the Nazis? None.
They don't think that I deserve an identity.
[in French] An American woman paid your bail.
I kept you for falsifying documents, but…
I see nothing false about you.
[Mary Jayne] Sir, please…
[in English] You told me he'd be out two hours ago,
and now I've been waiting here, and I…
Excuse me, are you Albert Hirschman?
-I'm Mary Jayne-- -I know. The American.
-Where's my sister? -Um…
There's a lot that I have to explain to you,
but… we are so late.
You're never gonna make it. Um…
I… I could drive you there. I'll drive you there.
You don't have somewhere else you need to be?
How old are you?
Twenty-five.
How old are you?
That's a very rude question.
And what do you do?
Do?
Professionally.
-I trained as an economist. -Oh.
But, uh, well, I've been running from the Nazis for so long,
at this point, I guess… I'm a professional refugee.
And a Jew.
Yeah. You know, being Jewish never really meant anything to me.
translation.ko: 유대인이라는 사실이 전에는 아무 의미 없었는데

translation.en: Now it's the most important thing about me.
What do you do?
I… do what I can.
translation.ko: 난 할 수 있는 걸 해요

translation.en: I have a car.
-A Mercedes, no less. -[chuckles]
People think there's nothing they can do to help, so they do nothing.
translation.ko: 사람들은 도울 방법이 없다며 아무것도 하지 않는 쪽을 택해요

translation.en: Most people don't expect rich, beautiful American girls to do anything.
translation.ko: 돈 많은 미모의 미국 여성이 뭘 할 거라고는 예상 못 하죠

translation.en: I'm missing my plane to Chicago tonight to drive you to the border of Spain.
translation.ko: 사실 오늘 밤 시카고행 비행기를 타야 하는데 당신을 데려다주고 있네요

translation.en: What's in Chicago?
Nothing.
People's assumptions about you can be useful if you know how to use them.
translation.ko: 사람들의 편견을 역이용하면 오히려 유용할 수 있어요

translation.en: Oh God.
-[Albert] Just play the American girl. -Yeah, what are you gonna do?
-[in French] Hello. Papers, please. -Oh. Yes, sir.
Excuse me, sir. Um…
[in English] We're in a hurry.
-[in French] Hurry… Hurry? -Ah. Why are you in a hurry?
[in English] We just had oysters.
[officer in French] Ah, oysters.
All good.
-Thank you. -You're welcome.
Let them pass!
[in English] Paul. Any news?
Nothing yet.
Your wife must have a lot to say. Never misses a day.
translation.ko: 사모님이 할 말이 많으신지 하루도 안 빠지고 보내시네요

translation.en: You married, Paul?
Not yet, sir. Just me and Petit. And our mother back home in Ouidah.
translation.ko: 아뇨, 저랑 프티뿐이에요 어머니는 우이다에 계시고요

translation.en: -Where is that? -West Africa, Mr. Fry.
Some say French Dahomey. But it used to be the Kingdom of Dahomey.
She want you home?
-She's just glad we are out of the army. -I am saving all my money to go home.
translation.ko: - 제대한 것만으로 좋아하시죠 - 집에 가려고 저축하고 있어요

translation.en: [chuckles] He wants to go back.
But I want to finish my studies. I have big plans.
translation.ko: 하지만 전 학업을 마치고 싶어요 계획이 있거든요

translation.en: Where's this from? There's no postage on this.
A man hand-delivered it this morning. He said he was an old friend.
Uh, do you have a map of the local area?
Yes. Yes, of course.
Here.
[in French] Thanks.
[in English] So, I think they can't be that far away
because you've already cut the distance in half. You see?
Mm-hmm.
Whoever's waiting for you in Chicago will be very disappointed tomorrow.
translation.ko: 시카고에서 기다리는 분이 내일 무척 실망하겠어요

translation.en: Thank you.
[Varian] Thomas.
Welcome to the Villa Air-Bel.
Whose house is this?
[chuckles] It belongs to a distant relative.
[Varian] And you're living here?
[Thomas] I just got here.
I'm still trying to get the electricity turned on.
I sent a letter to your home in New Jersey.
Your wife wrote back.
Told me you're saving the European brain trust from the Nazis.
translation.ko: 나치의 손아귀에서 유럽의 천재들을 구하고 있다며?

translation.en: How's that going?
It's going very well. Thank you.
You're still a terrible liar.
-[Varian] I have to get back to work. -Right now?
I'm doing something truly important here, maybe for the first time in my life.
translation.ko: 의미 있는 일을 하고 있어 평생 처음 있는 일일지도 몰라

translation.en: -[Thomas] I could help you. -And then what?
translation.ko: 나도 도울게 그러고 나면? 5년 동안 잠적하게?

translation.en: Disappear again for five years?
I thought you'd been captured, Thomas.
Or worse.
Thomas.
I can't let you distract me.
Never.
[in German] Just a few steps to the Spanish border.
-Is that good? -Yeah.
Say goodbye to France.
[man in English] Stop!
[in German] Run!
[man in French] Stop immediately!
Papers, please, everyone!
The village ahead is Spanish territory!
translation.ko: 저 앞에 있는 마을은 스페인 땅이다

translation.en: You cannot approach the border without a French exit stamp.
translation.ko: 프랑스의 출국 도장 없인 국경에 접근할 수 없다

translation.en: [in German] What the hell do you think you're doing?
translation.ko: 자네들 대체 누구길래 이러고 있는 건가?

translation.en: Why did you abandon your posts?
Huh? Unmanned tracts of the Spanish border
are under direct control of the Geheime Staatspolizei.
-[in French] What's that? -Gestapo.
[in German] Your presence is a violation of the Compiègne Armistice
translation.ko: 자네들이 여기 있다는 건 두 정부가 체결한 콩피에뉴 협정을

translation.en: between our two governments.
This is the new France, officers.
translation.ko: 이곳은 더 이상 옛날의 프랑스가 아니라네

translation.en: Performing duties beyond the limits of your jurisdiction
translation.ko: 관할을 벗어난 지역에서 업무 외 활동을 영위할 시

translation.en: is punishable by law. Do you understand that?
translation.ko: 관할을 벗어난 지역에서 업무 외 활동을 영위할 시 처벌받을 수 있어, 알겠나?

translation.en: -[in French] Yes. -[in German] Keep it straight.
Now run along back to your desks.
Go! Now! Run!
Hey.
Thank you.
[Albert] From Barcelona, we take the bus to Lisbon?
translation.ko: 바르셀로나에서 버스 타고 리스본으로 간다는 거지?

translation.en: [Ursula] Exactly.
Come.
-I can't do it. -[Ursula] What?
[woman] I'm going back.
-No. -[woman] I'm going.
Not you too?
-Listen to me. -I knew it.
There are so many people now in Marseille just waiting to get out.
translation.ko: 마르세유를 뜨고 싶어 하는 사람이 너무나도 많아

translation.en: We know how to get them out.
We observe Shabbat once with that old man and now you're Moses?
translation.ko: 그 아저씨랑 안식일 하루 보냈다고 모세라도 된 줄 알아?

translation.en: Ursula…
[Ursula] You'll both end up in a camp. Or dead.
translation.ko: 둘 다 수용소에 갇힐 거야 이러다 죽어

translation.en: -[horn honks] -Ursula…
You promised you'd stay with me.
Ursula.
Please understand.
I'll catch up with you in Lisbon. Do you hear?
Send word of your whereabouts to the Splendide. Did you hear me?
translation.ko: 스플렌디드 호텔에 연락해서 어디 있는지 알려줘 알았지?

translation.en: Send word of where you are to the Splendide!
[reporter in French] In Marseille, authorities declared
translation.ko: 마르세유 당국에서는 그간의 총체적인 관리 부실과 여러 건의 체포 사례로 인해

translation.en: that due to gross mismanagement, creating an illegal immigration crisis,
translation.ko: 그간의 총체적인 관리 부실과 여러 건의 체포 사례로 인해

translation.en: a series of arrests, and an unmanageable crisis for the police,
translation.ko: 경찰이 감당할 수 없는 위기에 처했음을 인지한 결과

translation.en: no passenger ships bound for points west will dock in Marseille or in France…
translation.ko: 프랑스 해안에 위치한 모든 항구에서 서쪽으로 향하는 여객선의 정박을 금하기로 결정했습니다 - 추후 공지가 있을 때까지… - 망할

translation.en: [in English] Damn it.
…until further notice.
In fact, all French ports will remain closed to all passenger ships
translation.ko: 여객선을 대상으로 모든 항구가 폐쇄될 예정이며

translation.en: until the threat of…
-[in English] Wait. Can they do that? -They just did it.
translation.ko: - 항구를 닫아요? 저래도 돼요? - 이미 결정한걸요

translation.en: [reporter] Vichy has instructed the police
to begin enforcement of Article 19 of the Franco-German armistice.
What's Article 19?
All refugees on French soil must be surrendered on demand.
translation.ko: '프랑스 영토에 속한 난민들은 요구에 따라 인계해야 한다'

translation.en: -To whom? -The German Reich.
You said they weren't gonna crack down.
translation.ko: 이런 식의 탄압은 없을 거라고 했잖아요

translation.en: I was wrong.
Wait. They can't actually deport people, can they?
-They can make it impossible to get out-- -It's already impossible.
translation.ko: 탈출을 막을 수는 있어도… 이미 막았잖아요

translation.en: But send them back? Now?
-[knocking] -[Varian] Come in!
Can I help you?
-[Albert] I'm looking for Miss Gold. -[Mary Jayne] What are you doing here?
translation.ko: - 골드 양을 찾아왔습니다 - 왜 여기 있어요?

translation.en: This is Lisa Fittko.
-She found a safe route into Spain. -[Mary Jayne] It worked?
translation.ko: 산을 통해 스페인으로 가는 동선을 찾아낸 분이죠 - 성공했어요? - 어젯밤에 국경을 넘었어요

translation.en: We went over last night
with five people who are now on their way to safety in Lisbon.
translation.ko: 현재 다섯 명이 안전한 리스본으로 가고 있어요

translation.en: Commissaire Frot!
So glad you could join me.
I just want to be absolutely sure that you understand the Article 19.
translation.ko: 협정 제19조 내용을 숙지하셨는지 확인하고 싶어서 왔습니다

translation.en: Yes, I read your cable.
Uh, all undesirables are to be surrendered upon demand to the local police.
translation.ko: '모든 외지인은 요구에 따라 지역 경찰에 인계해야 한다'

translation.en: Rosé?
Marseille is crawling with refugees from all over Europe.
Um, I am the chief of police, so it is my job to clean up the city.
translation.ko: 시경의 총책임자로서 도시를 청소하는 게 내 역할이죠

translation.en: You are the American consul, Mr. Patterson.
So it is your job to make sure that no American people make trouble for me.
translation.ko: 미국인이 내 일을 방해하지 않도록 힘써주시는 겁니다

translation.en: [in French] Of course.
[in English] Then what about the American Emergency Rescue Committee?
translation.ko: 그럼 미국 긴급 구조 위원회는 어떻게 되는 걸까요?

translation.en: [Frot] Despite my instructions, you issued the visa they requested
translation.ko: 제 요청에도 불구하고 독일인 작가 발터 베냐민에게 비자를 발급해 주셨던데요

translation.en: for German writer Walter Benjamin.
translation.ko: 독일인 작가 발터 베냐민에게 비자를 발급해 주셨던데요

translation.en: You said dangerous writers.
You never mentioned Walter Benjamin explicitly.
He writes about nonsense. How could he be dangerous?
He's on the Nazi blacklist.
So if this man leaves Marseille on my watch,
translation.ko: 그러니 만에 하나 그자가 마르세유를 벗어난다면

translation.en: I will hold you accountable.
Well, lucky for both of us, his boat got impounded a few days ago,
translation.ko: 뭐, 그럼 다행이네요 며칠 전에 배가 압수돼서

translation.en: so he's probably still shacked up at the Splendide.
Benjamin is at the Hotel Splendide?
Last I heard, they all were. Benjamin, Ernst, Breton.
translation.ko: 죄다 거기 있다던데요? 베냐민, 에른스트, 브르통

translation.en: If we cross the border before the guards show up at daybreak,
translation.ko: 순찰은 새벽에 시작하니까 저녁에 국경을 넘으면

translation.en: I could take… four people at a time, twice a week.
translation.ko: 한 번에 네 명씩 매주 두 번 구조할 수 있어요

translation.en: That's over 100 by Christmas.
And you don't need French exit stamps?
If they do, we'll just buy forgeries. That's easy.
translation.ko: 여차하면 위조하면 돼요 그건 일도 아니죠

translation.en: I need to keep this squeaky clean.
translation.ko: 이 작전에 불법이 묻어선 안 돼요

translation.en: Varian, this is our chance. Think about the number of people we can--
translation.ko: 베리언, 이건 기회잖아요 수많은 사람을 살릴 수 있는…

translation.en: What if the French police come after me and shut this down?
translation.ko: 프랑스 경찰이 나를 붙잡고 작전을 중단시키면요?

translation.en: [Albert] You don't have to know about it.
I'll deal with the black market. You remain clean.
-[Varian] Forgeries can't be cheap. -No.
translation.ko: - 위조 비용은 비싸요 - 싼 건 없어요

translation.en: I'll take care of it.
-We're also talking about train tickets. -[Mary Jayne] Mm-hmm.
-Hotels. Meals. -[Mary Jayne] I have the money.
No problem.
-Okay. -[Albert] Okay!
Okay! All right, well, that is settled, then.
Varian, you remain the face of the operation.
Lisa, you are the muscle.
-Albert's definitely the criminal. -Oh no! [chuckles]
Okay, then what are you?
Oh, I'm just the bank.
Give yourself more credit.
-[knock on door] -[Varian] Come in.
And who are you?
Paul. Kandjo.
-Oh, he's the brains. -[Paul] Uh, telegram for Mary Jayne.
translation.ko: 이분이 지략가예요 메리 제인에게 온 전보입니다

translation.en: [Lisa] We need a budget.
How much per person?
I'm sure people will be happy to share rooms.
[Varian] How easy is the hike?
[Varian] Right, Mary Jayne?
Mary Jayne, everything okay?
Yes.
Let's get back to work.
